title.narrative: Greater Mekong Subregion Ben Luc-Long Thanh Expressway Project - Tranche 2

description.narrative: The Project constructs a 57.1 km expressway between Ben Luc and Long Thanh in the south of Ho Chi Minh City (HCMC), which is a short link of the Greater Mekong Subregion (GMS) Southern Economic Corridor. The project expressway is divided into a western section (21.14 km), a middle section (10.71 km), and an eastern section (25.25 km). For the expressway construction, ADB finances the western and eastern sections, and Japan International Cooperation Agency (JICA) finances the middle section. The project was estimated to cost $1.608 billion at appraisal, inclusive of local taxes, contingencies, and financing charges during development. Tranche 2 in the amount of $286 million will cover construction of the eastern section of the expressway.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: A more efficient and safer movement of goods and people in the greater HCMC area.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President
Number of traffic accidents in the project area reduced by 10% (2012 baseline: 2,118 accidents in HCMC, Long An and Dong Nai provinces)

description.narrative: A more efficient and safer movement of goods and people in the greater HCMC area.

title.narrative: Transport costs reduced by 20% for east-west traffic in the southern HCMC area (2015 baseline: VND 6 million to transport a 40-feet container and VND 80,000 of bus fare between Ben Luc and Long Thanh)

description.narrative: A more efficient and safer movement of goods and people in the greater HCMC area.

title.narrative: Travel time reduced by 20% for east-west traffic in the southern HCMC area (2015 baseline: 1.5 hours for passenger cars and 2 hours for trucks and busses between Ben Luc and Long Thanh)

description.narrative: A more efficient and safer movement of goods and people in the greater HCMC area.

title.narrative: The number of trucks in general roads and highways in HCMC reduced by 30% (2015 baseline: 5,300 trucks per day on National Highway 1 in HCMC)

description.narrative: A more efficient and safer movement of goods and people in the greater HCMC area.
